Biography: George has spent all his life working on his family farm, and he's gotten tired of it. As much as he wants to do what is right for his family, he yearns to make something of himself, idolising his older brother who left to become a Paladin in the neighbouring kingdom. As another long summer draws to a close George dreams of running off and seeking a new life, though he knows he'll never have the courage to do so.

The sun begins on another long Wednesday afternoon. George sleepily stretched against the warm bark of a willow tree. He'd spent all day in the barley field and his body was paying for it dearly. His muscles were sore and he could feel the little prickle of insect bites start to make themselves known all down his forearm and neck. The height of summer in the countryside sounds idyllic to those who reside in the cities, but it's certainly no holiday for those who have to work the entire time!

George was already tired but knew the lingering hours of daylight would be put to good use by his ever present father, who would no doubt have a long list of things that "needed" to be done by nightfall. Going back to the farmhouse would surely result in another hour or so of drudgery.
11.title: George

112.content:
The setting of the sun was unlikely to get rid of the cloud of insects that plagued the fields at this time of years. The little flies were simply replaced by swarms of biting midgies and moths which were drawn into houses and around campfires. The best way to escape these pests was to dive into fast flowing water, and as luck would have it the nearby creek tumbled down a narrow canyon not far away, which sped up the flow and stopped the insects fro gathering.

George clambered nimbly down the banks that lined the creek, taking great care not to slip and fall on the crumbling clay. Whilst the steepness of the bank made it difficult to navigate down to the water, it kept away both prying eyes and any farm animals that would otherwise come down to drink. In all the times he'd swam here he'd never encountered a soul, and it provided him with some much needed solitude.

After a quick glance around just to double check nobody was there, George pulled off his sweaty farm clothes an stepped into the cool water. He instantly felt more relaxed, and wader in deeper till the water came up to his waist. This was as deep as it got at this middling section of the canyon, which was the shallowest part. Downstream it broadened out into a nice, deep pool, perfect for relaxing in, whilst upstream the water churned across several small rapids, treacherous for the inexperienced but a lot of fun to explore if one was confident in the water and knew the area.
112.title: Taking a dip

1123.content:
He only had a short time before the night drew in, and George wanted to make the most of it. He headed upstream, being careful to stick to paths through the water that he knew to be safe and free of any sharp rocks. As he reached the first plunge pool he leapt in, allowing himself to be fully submerged as the water swept above him. Holding onto some rocks, he kept himself underwater, letting the current blast away all of the grime and sweat that a life of farming brings. Eventually he resurfaced into the chaotic, noisy world of the rapids.

He felt like a new man after having the world's most intense shower, and was enthused with a new sense of adventure.

Before he could process this properly the smaller bandit had approached the cart.

113.content:
A few hours of relaxation couldn't hurt. He'd definitely earned it with all his work on the farm over the last few weeks, and the little town was only a short walk down a muddy track. Promising to himself that he wouldn't stay out too late, he set off.

He was fortunate enough not to encounter anyone as he passed by his family fields. He felt quietly guilty already about heading off anyway, so there was no way he'd have been able to come up with a decent enough excuse if he had bumped into anyone he knew.

The small town of Wyrm lay only a couple of miles down the road, and it was a pleasant walk now that the sun was starting to set. Town may have been a bit of an exaggeration; Wyrm's population could have been no more than a couple of hundred people at most, and primarily served as the marketplace for the hundreds of farms and hamlets that dotted the surrounding barony. Small, rural, and peaceful, it was one of many petty states that lay in the triangle of land named Byland that was nestled between the Brythonic Confederacy, Kingdom of the Alemmani, and Diocese of Strasburg, left alone because they always had been, rather than due to the prowess of their warriors. Nothing ever really exciting happened amongst these fields or rolling hills. George remembered coming home from school one day, his head buzzing with stories of monsters and heroes after being told by one of his friends that her dad old her that the town got its name from an ancient beast who was slain their hundreds of years ago, the church being built on the land where its body had fallen. But George's dad immediately told him that this was all a lie, saying that Wyrms never existed outside of fairy tales ("Have you ever seen one?" He asked, "No" George had to admit), and that the real story was that the town was named after the winding river that ran through it. He told him to stop day dreaming about monsters and get ready to help on the farm. And that had been the end of that discussion.
That was how things had always ended whenever George had brought up the possibility of an existence beyond the green fields of Byland. It was only his sense of duty to his work that had stopped George going mad with boredom a long time ago.

His daydreaming had carried him to the edge of the town, and he was surprised to see so much of it was still awake despite the darkening sky. The traders had long departed but the rest of the townsfolk were trying to get the last of their chores done before the darkness set it, as Wyrm wasn't a town wealthy or large enough to afford the expense of street lighting. As he picked his way down the main street he noticed the familiar sign of The Black Dragon Inn swaying in the gentle breeze. To the left stood the blacksmiths where he knew he should inquire on the cost of fixing his plough. To the right sat a beggar, down on his luck.

This time it was quicker than him and managed to lift him clean off his feet, tossing him into the undergrowth. Winded, he could do nothing as the animal quickly strode over to him. It placed one foot on his left arm, snapping the tricep in an instant, sending unbearable pain racing across his body. The wolf crouched over him and he could smell its rancid breath on his face and hear it grunting and panting in victory, and realised in horror that he was about to die, torn apart in the woods. He slammed shut his eyes as a scream echoed across the clearing.

The heavy weight of the beast was thrown off of him, crashing onto his mangled arm, causing him to cry out again. He opened his eyes to see the beast half lying on top of him, trying to swat away Hengist who had rallied and was now striking its head with his hooves. His body surging with adrenaline, anger, and magic, Toni grabbed his blade and stuck it hard into the werewolf's unprotected neck. Howls immediately turned to gurgles as it thrashed around, yanking the sword out of his hand but allowing him to pull himself free. Standing over it he pulled his sword out of its neck and began swinging and hacking with abandon, each cut producing a whimper from the beast that grew quieter and quieter. Eventually it stopped moving and Toni stood above it panting, one arm dangling uselessly. Suddenly the corpse began to spasm and sizzle as the flesh, muscle, and finally bone began to dissolve as if it were dropped into acid. As it did so Toni's arm began to re-heal, flesh and bone rebuilding itself until it looked and felt like nothing had happened. The "werewolf" had been nothing more than a summoned creature, a fake, a guardian intended to kill anyone who got too close. But it had failed. Its intended victim was not only victorious, but incredibly angry.

Toni turned to face the path where the beast had come from, his eyes gleaming orange and his blade flickering with a flame. He would give no quarter now.
1322.title: Showdown

choices: Confrontation
13221.content:
Toni knew that the monastery must be aware of his presence by now, having sensed the besting of their creature. They'd be doing their best to hide the secrets he desired, and fortify their defences. He had to move fast. He allowed the rage to take over him, and his eyes flashed yellow whilst his sword ignited in crimson flame. No need to mask his approach now, they knew what was coming for them.

A moment of humanity crept back into him as he comforted Hengist, and asked his loyal steed to stay there, hidden in the undergrowth. But it soon passed and he was marching through the thick bracken, sword singeing the bushes as it went. He only had to walk a few hundred metres more before he noticed an orange glow in the distance. Fire. The monastery complex was on fire.

He broke into a run. He was here for all the information stored in the complex's libraries; it was no used if it was burnt to a crisp. He skidded to a halt as he reached the treeline ahead of the clearing in which the building stood. Surveying the scene before him he saw that every single building was burning. This had been done deliberately; clearly they weren't strong believers in their own defences. He raised his sword in readiness and waited. Nothing. Not a single soul emerged from the flaming inferno to take the field against him. Where were the monks of the order? Their laymen? Even the horses in the stables had gone. They must have fled into the night like the cowards they were.

He walked into the clearing, his boot crushing flaming ash. The flames igniting from his sword were dwarfed by the enormous conflagration raging above, devouring hundreds of volumes of precious knowledge every second. But his goal had changed. The knowledge couldn't be gleamed from the records anymore, but it could be taken from someone who was here, alive. Someone was here and waiting for him.
He smiled, sensing the man finally emerge from the ruins to confront him. "Ah, one of the old Masters himself. I'm honoured that you'd face me, rather than run and hide like the rest of your snivelling order".
13221.title: Towering inferno

choices: Show the Master the power of dark magic (Magic check)
Go all out with the melee attacks (Strength check)
132211.content:
A broad man in his 50s stood in the middle of the deserted plaza, the golden glow of the fire bouncing off his white armour. Master Frank's bearded face was grim and determined; he was a veteran of many battles and he wasn't going to be intimidated by any upstart dictator.
"Where's the rest of your Order" Toni snarled, flipping his sword in his hand and assuming a ready stance. "Don't tell me you waited her alone, to try and stop me?"
"They are long gone" The Master replied calmly, "They are beyond your grasp, as are our records" He gestured to the flakes of burning paper that fell amongst them like hellish snow. "Our sacrifice here is for the greater good. There seems to be no end to your evil schemes".
"Spare us the heroes monologue" Toni said, grinning. "I don't want to kill you, you know this. Step aside and let me get the knowledge I need. You can then carry on your miserable existence".
The Knight raised his sword and took a step forward. "You know I can't do that". He said. "Your appetite for cruelty and destruction knows no bounds. To stay that you'll stop here and remain in your little principality is such an obvious lie that I'm surprised you even wasted your time saying it out loud. There once was a time when you'd have made a good public here, but the others were right to reject you, it is plainly obvious now".

A white hot rage filled Toni and he fired off a fire blast, snarling as he did so. It impacted the knight head on but harmlessly dissipated into nothing. He immediately felt very embarrassed and foolish. He shouldn't have allowed the Master to provoke him as easily as that, he should be calmer and not let his enemies get a rise out of him with comments about his background, In the future he would be better. He had to be.

He attacked again, firing off a blast of air that sent the knight staggering back a few feet. Much better. Keep focussed and he is yours, Toni said to himself. The master charged forward and the two were soon locked in an intense sword fight. The masters heavy Zweihänder would knock Toni back a little each time he brought it to bare, but it was less maneuverable than his classic longsword. Stamina and energy would be the key decider in this battle, as both men were accomplished swordsmen.

Toni sought to exploit his superior agility by attempting to tire his opponent out. He darted amongst the burning ruins, throwing spells with every chance he got, ignoring the burning air that was choking his lungs. He forced his opponent to keep running to catch up, always just behind the more nimble and aggressive youngster. But he made mistakes. He nearly fell from a burning piece of floorboard into a wine cellar that had become a burning pit, only being saved at the last minute by hearing it start to give way beneath him. He was also cocky, and underestimated his opponents ability to produce a quick burst of speed, bringing his heavy sword down on his with such force as to nearly snap it in two like a twig. After a few more rounds of combat both men were beginning to tire, not helped by the fact that the very air they were breathing in was incredibly toxic, and was burning their throats. The hunger in Toni increased as his stamina decreased however. He needed this. He had to win this. It was his birthright.
132211.title: Confrontation

choices: Morning
1322111.content:
Toni knew he didn't have the brawn to beat Frank in a melee battle, but reckoned his knowledge of magic would be more than the knight could handle. Panting, he withdrew slightly and waved his sword, grinning, goading his enemy to charge.

Magic Check!
Toni's magic level is: 8
Magic check passed!

It worked.

Buoyed by how easily Toni was beaten back Frank charged. He swung his two-handed sword and struck the Prince hard in his breastplate, producing an impressive sounding thwack, accompanied by it cracking all the way down to his waist. Frank grinned, and raised his sword again, sensing victory was near. But Toni was grinning as well. He raised his left hand and shouted, sending a wave of dark energy soaring toward the defenseless knight. Frank only had time to yell before he was thrown backwards several metres, crashing into a pile of rubble, his head dazed. Through his scrambled vision he could see the victorious Prince slowly moving toward him, his sword still primed, ready for any last attacks. But he had neither the desire or energy to resist any longer. He had failed. With his last strength he attempted to summon a telepathic message to the council.
"We have underestimated him. He has grown in power more than anyone could have predicated. Summon the allies we have and march on his capital, for if he is not stopped now he wil-"
His message was silenced as the advancing Prince closed his fist, his magic overwhelming anything the exhausted knight could offer up. Frank looked into the eyes of the boy that could have once made a fantastic member of the Order and only saw the blazing yellow of someone bent on domination and control. His eyes rolled back and he began to pass out from the force of the devastating spell cast against him. But he would not get the respite he so desperately wanted.

Toni pulled Frank toward him with an effortless flick of his wrist. The knight slid forward, coming to rest by Toni's feet, his head lolling. With another flick Toni had Frank's face gazing up at him. "Much better" he said, his eyes blazing with power and hatred. "A Master of the Order has fell to me, quite the story. You'll make a fantastic addition to my Praetorian Guard".

He raised his right hand and a small ball of black energy began to form, drawing in power from the surrounding air. "Open your mouth" He said. Frank could do nothing but obey. Toni unzipped his pants and pulled out his cock. Pumped full of adrenaline and success it only took a few strokes from his hand to bring him near to climax, and he fired his hot load straight into the awaiting mouth of the dazed knight. "Close your mouth, stand up, do not swallow". Frank obeyed, his eyes beginning to glass over. Toni pulled his zip up and brought the now considerable black ball into both hands. He began to mould the almost liquid substance into various shapes, until it eventually settled on the style of helmet his most loyal bodyguard used, complete with face mask. He looked upon Frank's face for one final time, and noticed with pleasure that his cum had splattered all across his beard. He reached over and forced the helmet onto his head, ending his time as one of the Master's of the Order, and welcoming him into the eternal servitude.

In the clearing Toni pulled himself back up onto Hengist, pausing to cough as another wave of black smoke drifted toward him from the flaming wreckage. The archives were lost but the mind of the old Master was more than he could ever dream of. Once they returned to his manor he would be able to access all the information he could ever want. Spell construction, weapons research, troop deployments, they would be all his. But for now he'd have a little fun. He glanced down at Frank, stood completely naked save the helmet, and waiting patiently for commands.
"You know where to go" Toni said. "It will take you 4hours. Run"
Frank obediently set off jogging in the direction of the manor house, guided by the dark helmet that now controlled him. Toni managed a laugh before setting off on his horse, easily taking over his latest acquisition. He had reached home just as dawn was breaking over the trees and waved away all attempts at assistance from his servants and drones. Finally reaching his chamber he did not even bother to remove his sweat soaked underarmour, instead collapsing into a long, badly needed slumber.
1322111.title: Brain over brawn

choices: Interrogation
13221111.content:
Kroos felt hot breath on his face and woke up with a start. In the dawn gloom he saw a grinning face pressed against his and he reacted automatically, summoning his sword from the bedside table into his hand. Midway through its flight it was grabbed by the person who loomed over him, and he felt the cold press of steel against his neck. The person above him laughed and he recognised it instantly.
"Felix" He said, sighing in relief, sweating profusely. "Why did you do that"
His brother grinned, clambering off the bed and tossing Toni's sword away. "It's funny" he said simply, shrugging. "Besides, I like to remind you that my reflexes are faster, even after all your training. Toni smiled and sat upright. From the open window he could see the pink dawn was giving way to the blue of the day, and the muffled sounds of workshops and stables starting up were beginning to creep through from the other side of the complex. He loved this lodge more than most of its other properties. His rooms were set back away from the main work areas, providing him with the silence and peace of the forest, but he was close enough to his men to feel involved in everything they do, and not live as some removed feudal master. It was important to him that he was seen as one of them, someone who wasn't afraid to get involved in hard labour or fight in the front line, whatever his rank or situation.
"You came home late again last night" Felix said, watching his brother get dressed.
"I did" Toni said, washing his face in the basin next to his bed.
"And you came home alone" Felix said. "You didn't take any of your guardsmen with you, and when I asked your page were you'd gone he told me that if I followed you I-"
"You'd be flayed alive and your head would be stuck on a pike", Toni finished, drying his face. "The same thing I tell them to say all the time. Don't worry, I may not have taken any guards out with me but I brought one back".
"So I saw" Felix said, coming over to his brother and placing a hand on his back. Toni felt something deep inside him clench as his brothers hand touched him. Not out of revulsion, but because of something else. Something he'd repressed long ago. "I'm worried about you". He continued. "Let me come along, you need me".
"I do brother" Toni said, pushing him away gently. "If something happens to me I need you to carry on our work here. The men will listen to you.
"Your work" Felix said, raising his eyebrows and smirking slightly. "This" he said waving his hand in the air "Is all your idea. The men believe in you, not me. You know exactly what you want to achieve, I know nothing. I don't even know why you went to the monastery last night, nor what you plan on doing with the prisoner".
Toni nodded understandably. "I admit I've been distant, too focussed on planning and plotting rather than making sure everyone actually understand what I want to do" He said. "But now's your chance. Come with me and let's see what knowledge our little friend from the Order has in his head".
The brothers made their way down to the guard barracks of the main courtyard. "And I suppose you have a plan for when the entire Order comes marching into our little nation in retribution".
Toni turned around and winked. "Naturally".
13221111.title: Morning

choices: War gaming
132211111.content:
The two men watched as the newest recruit to the Praetorian Guard marched toward them. The man that used to be one of the orders Masters was still naked save the helmet, and his muscular body was covered in cuts, burns, and bruises from his battle with Toni and then run through thick woodland and moor. Most of his wounds were now bandaged, and none looked too severe. He'd recover fully and make a fine addition to the guard. Felix was always uneasy whenever the Praetorians were involved. The face guards of the new recruits creeped him out, and it was even worse once they'd fought in battle and were allowed to remove them, and their soulless eyes were visible to the world. Whatever his brother did to them to make them so obedient was unnatural, and he didn't like it. He'd disband them all if he were ever in the position his brother was in, but his brother seemed to view them as indispensable.

The guard stopped before them both, bowed, and knelt on the ground. Toni approached him, squatted down, and opened the face guard. Frank's face looked as if nothing had happened, except he was staring straight ahead of him, ignoring his masters presence and gaze. At least he still has something behind his eyes, thought Felix, shivering as his made eye contact with the guard standing straight across the courtyard from him. Toni traced his fingers down Frank's throat, gazing at his quarry with a look that was approaching lust. He suddenly gripped his throat, and forced him to swallow. The cum that his servant had obediently kept in his mouth for hours was now gone, and he was free to talk. Toni raised his right palm and a gentle beam of yellow light emanated from it, entering Frank's mind. His eyes unfocussed and his jaw hung open, as Toni was allowed inside. Toni reached behind him and took ahold of his brother's hand. Gently he guided Felix so he was kneeling beside him, and made him lock his hand around the back of his own. Felix felt the surge of magic pass through his brother and into him as well, and the two of them felt themselves being yanked forward into a flash, falling into a white vortex that was the mind of the Master.

The brothers found themselves standing amongst the monastery that the Master used to run. It was intact once more and ghostly flashes of people wandered between the rooms and porticos, their chatter indistinct and confusing, as though it was coming from underwater. "Stay close" Toni said, taking his brother's hand and guiding them up a marble staircase. "Memory access is dangerous at the best of times, and with two people in at once, one who's never done it before, something might go wrong".
"Now you tell me" Felix said, half listening. He gazed in wonder at the shimmering walls of the monastery. Everything gleamed brightly, as though bathed in a holy light, but on closer inspection it was almost as if it shone to cover up the lack of detail. Everything looked almost unfinished, or as if one was looking at it from far away, through a broken spyglass. Memories didn't hold detail on backgrounds and characters not central to the creator, Felix realised, so this is basically a mirage, the Master's mind filling in what he thinks was there at the time. He followed his brother up the main flight of stairs, allowing apparitions to pass straight through him as if neither of them were there. He couldn't feel any heat nor smell anything, not until they approached the Master's chambers, when things changed.

Everything was much clearer here. There was a pleasant smell of a wood fire and polished furniture. Books that filled the shelves had some of their titles on, and the paintings were mostly decipherable. Felix paused to inspect the Master's old armour that stood propped against the bed. It gleamed white in the light thrown from the candles. He'd never wear it again. The grey of the Praetorians would suffice from now on.
Toni began thumbing through documents on the table, looking for anything that would help him get an idea on the plans of the order.
"What are you looking for?" Felix asked, joining him.
"Magic and weapons research mainly" Kroos said. "The Order is years ahead of us on developing new spells and techniques, but our only saving grace has been that they've been lured into being complacent. Without any external threat they've pretty much stopped inventing and coming up with new things. We have a narrow windor of time to catch up before they realise the threat we pose, and mobilise their massive resources. Aside from that, anything on troop deployments, castle plans, diplomatic texts. Anything you spot that you think we give us the edge in the upcoming conflict". Felix nodded and began to look through the volumes that were scattered around the room. Every so often he heard a soft whooshing noise, as his brother magically absorbed the knowledge from any tomes he deemed valuable.

The door to the study opened, and in walked Frank. He was without his helmet, but remained completely naked, his body still baring the scars from his battle in the forest. "My masters" He droned, bowing low. He walked over to his desk and began producing several documents from thin air, before handing them to a gleeful Toni, who absorbed them quickly.
"You're serving me well already" He said, stroking his latest recruits thick chest muscles. "Oh how quickly you've turned against your old side. You'll find ours is a lot more suited to your talents." Toni pulled Frank in and the two began to kiss passionately, the old Master lifting the young Prince up into the air, and pinning him to his body. As they did so the world began to shimmer and collapse in on itself. Felix only had time to grasp Toni's shoulders before the world went black and they fell back into the courtyard.

Toni pulled himself up to his feet, and with a rush of embarrassment realised he'd came in his pants. In front of him Frank remain kneeling, having blasted his own load. Toni helped pull Felix to his feet and patted his brother down, grinning. "Did you enjoy that?" He asked.
"Not really" Felix said, looking green and swaying on his feet slightly. He glanced up at his brother and realised his smirk had been replaced by a serious look.
"Summon your subordinates" Toni said, putting his hand on his shoulder. "Have everyone assemble in my study by 4pm. We need to move quickly".
132211111.title: The mind's eye

1322112.content:
The time for spell flinging was over. Only a show of brute strength would win the day, and cement his victory over the Order and the Master that now stood in his way. Toni channelled all his inner hate and anger, his will to dominate, and his greed at acquiring all the land and treasure that lie ahead, let it build inside him, and charged. He swung his sword upward, sending the Zweihänder flying into the air and into a burning patch of debris. His body shoved hard into that of the Master's and he heard his enemy yell out in pain.

Strength check
Toni's strength level is: 4
Strength check failed!

Toni pushed hard against Frank's heavy body armour, every sinew in his body flowing with power and desperately trying to shove the massive knight ahead of him to the ground. But with a great yell Frank grabbed Toni's sword hand and crushed it effortlessly in his mighty grasp. Toni cried out and dropped his sword, his hand now hanging uselessly at his side, his fingers crushed. Before he could react Frank smacked him across the face, throwing him to the floor. His head hit the ground and he saw stars, very nearly blacking out. He felt the heavy weight of a foot on his chest, and throw the acrid smoke he saw the panting knight above him, victorious.

"Anger and hatred are not emotions that produce victory" He said, staring down with a cold glare. "You could have become something the Order would have been proud to tutor and nurture, but you chose this path instead. It has led you to defeat". Toni spat in anger and tried to roll out of the way from Frank, but it was no use. The knight raise his other hands and Toni felt his limbs slam close to his body, leaving him trapped and at the mercy of the knight that stood before him. "Foolish boy". Frank said firmly. "I would be within my right to kill you, for all the pain you've caused. But no, I will be merciful. You will live, but your new life will be very different from the path you've taken so far.". He raised his hand and pointed his palm at the cowering Prince. A beam of white light shot from it and enveloped the both of them.

2 months later

Frank walked into his rebuilt chambers, throwing his fur coat to the floor, not taking his eyes of the latest briefing from the central council. He let out a shrill whistle "Boy, he shouted gruffly. Toni emerged from the next room, at least it used to be Toni. He was completely naked save for a bow tie and tight black underwear, and staring straight ahead, his bright blue eyes glassy as if he were artificial. Wordlessly he bowed and picked up his masters coat, placing it in the appropriate place. Frank sat down and gazed over the latest report, and update on how the rebuilding of the Principality of Pommerburg was proceeding after the defeat of the Dark Prince and the liberation of its oppressed populace. The council held him in high esteem ever since his victory of the prince, slaying him and preventing precious information from falling into the hands of the enemy. At least, that's what the official reports said. Nobody else knew that Toni didn't die that night. Masters of the Order were supposed to eschew worldly goods, and they certainly weren't supposed to ever engage in slavery, a cardinal sin. But that boy was too good to pass up. He was too devious to be brought to trial, and too pretty to waste and kill. No, he was working in the role that suited him best now.
"Down" He said, still not looking up. Toni quickly darted over and took his place as his master's footstool, the eyes that once burned with malice now empty to the world. Frank laughed to himself. This would be their little secret.

15512.content:

Sven and Lars laugh and joke as they hike, the late summer son warms their backs as they climb up into the dusty hills above the ancient capital. Both are dressed in simple, short cream-coloured togas. Lars' arms are thick and bronzed from a summer in the sparring fields, Sven notices.

"So where are we going again?, Lars asks casually.
"The temple ruins at Arima," Sven replies, forging ahead confidently. "It's the Palace complex supposedly built by the Founders: where they grew up as farmers, and where they won their last battle against the Punic Magocracy," he explains happily, "and thus where the Empire was born."

He expects a teasing remark, but Lars nods thoughtfully and looks interested. "Why was it so important?", he asks earnestly.

"It was the last attempt by the 13 Blood Mages of Palaetyrus to bring the Continent to heel. Winner takes all gambit: they sacrificed 500 corruption stones and 5000 slaves to summon the Dread Beast. It took all the strength and courage and magic of the Founders to overcome it." They crest the last hill and at last see the ruins in the valley below. It truly is impressive: among the largest and the finest Elysian architecture, and even half ruined, the Temple soars into the sky with its proud bone-white columns and imposing statues. Shrines and houses are scattered around it, but a paved avenue to the steps is still visible. They walk with heads craned up, soaking in all the details as they approach, Sven reciting softly as he approaches:

"They thundered hard and mightily: and the earth around resounded terribly and the wide heaven above, and the sea and Ocean's streams and the nether parts of the earth. Great Oranous reeled beneath the divine feet of the Consuls as they arose and earth groaned thereat. The whole earth seethed, and sky and sea: and the long waves raged along the beaches round and about at the rush of the deathless gods: and there arose an endless shaking. Antonious trembled where he rules over the dead below, because of the unending clamor and the fearful strife."
